 Name of source file.

Detailed Description

Both generates and loads sitemaps. Kinda glues together the different parts in an ad hoc manner. This works, but the interface is quite clunky.

const std::vector< std::string > &  waters,
BoundingVolume *  site_vol,

std::vector< atom_vci > *  bind_atoms,
std::vector< atom_vci > *  rad_atoms 
) [private]

Parameters:
hbond_density Density to discretely sample hydrogen bonding volume
params_dir Directory holding the hbond point sampling files
site_vol Pointer to the sitemap volume
include_waters True implies include all water molecules in the protein structure as "part of the protein".
include_metals True implies include all metal atoms in the the protein structure as "part of the protein".
rad_atoms Pointer to vector to hold rad atoms.

) [private]

Parameters:
hphob_method which hydrophobic model/method to use
cluster_diameter The maximum cluster diameter for complete link clustering of hphob points.

!fail()

bool Sitemap::has_enough_points (  ) 

Determine if the site map has enough points given the current implementation of the site maps, alignment method, and alignment techniques scoring

const my_float_t *  T 
) [inline]

BoundingVolume * Sitemap::setup_volume ( const std::string  ligand_fname,
const my_float_t  grid_spacing,
const std::string  sphere_str,
const bool  use_union_of_balls 
) [private]

Setup the sitemap volume.

Parameters:
ligand_fname Path to the ligand to define the binding site volume
grid_spacing The rectuangular grid sampling distance
sphere_str Sphere as center and radius in a string
use_union_of_balls If a ligand is given and use_union_of_balls is true, take the union of balls (1 centered at each ligand atom) as the volume estimate and not the ligand bounding box.
Returns:
Pointer to the volume object or NULL if an error occured
